title: Preseason 1-2 Texas, Penn St. fall out of Top 25

title: ‚õ≥ Ryder envelope rule must change, Bradley says
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley said the Ryder Cup's longstanding envelope rule involving injured players should change, but European counterpart Luke Donald said it's there to protect players and should remain in place.

title: üó£Ô∏è Players support Collier in ripping WNBA
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: üí∞ Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

content: Manchester United are among the Premier League clubs eyeing Barcelona goalkeeper Marc-Andr√© ter Stegen. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Hyderabad logged over 9,000 road crashes in 2023
content: The 2023 NCRB report recorded 335 road accident deaths in Hyderabad; data shared by the police in the tri-commissionerate shows there were 1,779 deaths

content: While the Governor hit out at the slogan during a function at the Raj Bhavan, the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu later responded through a social media post

content: Russia‚Äôs decision to supply JF-17 jet engines to Pakistan a failure of PM‚Äôs personalised diplomacy, says Congress

title: Bihar polls | Nitish retains edge but undercurrents remain
content: The political landscape of Bihar reflects the rivers that define it. At first glance, the NDA alliance steered by Nitish appears as the Ganges‚Äô main channel ‚Äî broad and seemingly unstoppable. But in the deltas and backwaters, streams of dissent are forming and many voters are yet to choose which current to follow

title: Blanket ban on political events is unacceptable: Anbumani
content: He appeals to political parties to accept and comply with the reasonable conditions imposed by the government for the safe conduct of political meetings

title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to visit Australia on October 9
content: The visit comes at a significant moment as India and Australia are marking five years of their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership

content: What is Alternative Dispute Resolution and how does it work in India? How long does it take to resolve disputes? What legal provisions support ADR and its processes? How can they reduce delays and court pendency effectively? Which States have the highest backlog of cases?

title: Supreme Court to hear plea raising question if military discipline overwhelms religious freedom in Armed Forces
content: The petition has been filed by a Christian Army officer who was issued order of termination from service for refusing to enter the sanctum sanctorum of the regiment‚Äôs temple to perform pooja

title: U.S. military beard ban: SAD chief Sukhbir Badal seeks Jaishankar's intervention
content: SAD chief said the U.S. government categorically acknowledged the right of the Sikh members of the U.S. armed forces to preserve their external symbols of religious identity, including turban and beard

title: India is ‚Äòfirst responder‚Äô to Nepal, assures PM Modi as flood hits Nepal
content: PM Modi assures immediate assistance as heavy rains cause loss of lives and damage infrastructure across the Himalayan nation

title: Cough syrup contamination:¬†Health Ministry directs strict compliance with revised Schedule M norms
content: The Ministry has warned that licences of non-compliant units would be cancelled; the direction comes after an emergency meeting with all States and Union Territories¬†on Sunday

title: Tandem cycle donation lets visually impaired person to join global inclusion fest
content: The project aims to empower visually impaired individuals by enhancing mobility, independence, and social inclusion, says president of Rotary Club of Bangalore Northwest

title: India-U.S. trade deal has to respect New Delhi‚Äôs ‚Äòred lines‚Äô; efforts underway to address issues: Jaishankar
content: The External Affairs Minister said an understanding on trade between the two sides was necessary as the U.S. is the world‚Äôs largest market

title: Internet Banned, 36-Hour Curfew In Odisha's Cuttack After Clashes
content: Odisha's Cuttack, the thousand-year-old city long celebrated for its communal harmony, remained on edge on Sunday after fresh incidents of violence erupted following clashes during Durga Puja idol immersion two days earlier.

title: "It Will Last A Couple Of Days": Trump On Gaza Deal Talks
content: President Donald Trump on Sunday said talks on implementing a truce for Gaza will take days, while his foreign policy chief Marco Rubio warned that Israel needs to stop bombing for a hostage release to happen.

title: "We Took Documents, A Few Clothes And Ran": Witnesses On Darjeeling Horror
content: Residents in West Bengal's Darjeeling narrated the horror they lived through in the pitch black night at 2.30 am when a key bridge in the area collapsed. A local told NDTV the bridge took along two houses as it came crashing down into the river.

title: School Manager Arrested For Raping Class 8 Student In UP: Cops
content: A school manager allegedly raped a class 8 student here, police said on Sunday. The accused has been arrested.

title: Video: Speeding BMW Rams Bike In Hyderabad. Woman Injured, Driver On The Run
content: A speeding BMW has rammed two cars and a bike on the outskirts of Hyderabad. A woman riding pillion on the bike sustained severe injuries. All three vehicles were badly damaged.

title: India's "Red Lines" Have To Be Respected: S Jaishankar On Trade Deal With US
content: Any trade deal between India and the US has to respect New Delhi's "red lines" and efforts are underway to find a "landing ground", External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said.

title: Rajinikanth Enjoys Food From 'Pattal' On Roadside During Trip To Rishikesh
content: Taking a short break from his overwhelming work commitments, superstar Rajinikanth took off to the Himalayas for some spiritual recharge.

title: Israel, Hamas Prepare For Talks In Egypt Ahead Of Possible Gaza Ceasefire
content: Israel and Hamas prepared for indirect negotiations in Egypt on Monday, as hopes for a possible ceasefire in Gaza began to build after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said a hostage release could be announced this week.

title: 20 Dead In Darjeeling After Heavy Rain Triggers Landslides, Sikkim Cut Off
content: Twenty people have died in West Bengal's Darjeeling after heavy rain triggered landslides and cut off road connectivity on key routes. Officials have said the calamity has cut off connectivity to the Himalayan state of Sikkim.

title: Kaziranga's Newborn Elephant Calf Named 'Mayabini' After Zubeen Garg's Song
content: In a heartwarming moment on World Animal Day on Saturday, a newborn elephant calf in Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve has been named 'Mayabini', after Zubeen Garg's beloved song that became an anthem for his fans.

title: Boy, 8, Dies After Falling From Balcony While Playing In Gurugram: Cops
content: An eight-year-old boy died after falling from the balcony of a house on the second floor here, police said on Sunday.

title: Centre Holds High-Level Meeting After Cough Syrup Deaths
content: The Union Health Ministry on Sunday held an emergency high-level meeting with health secretaries and drug control officials from all States and Union Territories in the wake of multiple child deaths linked to contaminated cough syrup.

title: DK Shivakumar Says No To Jewellery Question In Caste Survey, BJP Reacts
content: The Congress government's ongoing socio-economic and educational survey in Karnataka has come under sharp attack from the Opposition after Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar declined to answer some questions asked by enumerators.

title: "Clearly Can't Run Government": Tejashwi Yadav On Nitish Kumar's Viral Video
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday alleged that Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's "erratic" behaviour at a function of Prime Minister Narendra Modi a day ago has given rise to fresh suspicions about his "mental health".

title: 'Gaza War Not Yet Over, Priority Is To Get Hostages Out': Marco Rubio
content: The war in Gaza has "not yet" ended,US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday, describing the release of the hostages held by Hamas as the first phase, while details on what happens after that still need to be worked out.

title: Pilots Body Urges Aviation Body To Probe Electrical Systems of All Boeing 787s
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) on Sunday urged aviation safety regulator DGCA to thoroughly check and investigate the electrical system of all Boeing 787 aircraft in the country.

title: Rajasthans 14 Million Tonne Lithium Reserve Set To Reduce India's Dependence On China
content: A 14 million tonne lithium reserve in Rajasthan could make India self-reliant in the critical mineral and reduce dependence on China.

title: Thackeray Brothers Meet Again, Signal Political Reunion Ahead Of Civic Polls
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray reached Matoshree - house of Shiv Sena UBT chief Uddhav Thackeray -- for the second time in recent months on Saturday, marking his fifth meeting with his cousin this year.

title: Mohan Bhagwat's "I Have To Take It Back" Comment On PoK Draws Applause
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has called Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) a room in a house called India, but one in which strangers have moved in.

title: Video: Lion Attacks Lioness In Gujarat's Gir, She Fights Back
content: Rajya Sabha member and wildlife enthusiast Parimal Nathwani has shared a video capturing the dramatic interaction between a lion and a lioness in the Gir Forest in Gujarat.

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. agrees to fix in-service quota for PHC doctors in clinical branches at 20% this year
content: The doctors vow to continue the strike, insisting that the quota be fixed for five years as they cannot be expected to stage protest every year

title: GROUND REPORT: Inside Bengaluru‚Äôs citywide Social and Educational Survey
content: Enumerators say the public are refusing to cooperate. ‚ÄúSome are not even opening the door after seeing us. With this kind of cooperation, even completing three or four surveys is a big achievement,‚Äù they say.

title: New museum in Kollam celebrates A. Ramachandran‚Äôs works
content: Inaugurating the museum, Chief Minister says the painter‚Äôs art works are a link that connects contemporary Indian painting to its traditional past as well as its future

title: 36-hour curfew imposed in parts of Odisha‚Äôs Cuttack after attack on Durga Puja rally; internet blackout in effect for a day
content: As many as 25 police personnel have received injuries in incidences of violence since Friday (October 3) night. The VHP has called a dawn-to-dusk bandh in protest on October 6

title: TDB denies using surplus fund for Global Ayyappa Sangamam
content: Funds for the Sangamam were received entirely from sponsors, says TDB president P.S. Prasanth. Unspent amount will be credited to the Devaswom fund

title: Waiting for Thiruvonam bumper lottery¬†winner
content: Speculations about the identity of the winner spread after the lottery agent who sold the ticket, said that it could be that of a woman residing in Nettoor

title: TDB Vigilance questions Potti for the second day¬†over Sabarimala temple artefacts controversy
content: After a 4-hour questioning at at the TDB headquarters in Thiruvananthapuram, the priest who occasionally worked at Sabarimala says he is the victim of a media witch-hunt

title: Uproar as woman patient allegedly denied treatment due to her religion in U.P.‚Äôs Jaunpur¬†
content: Opposition parties alleged that such instances are result of divisive politics and communalism practised by the ruling BJP¬†

title: Puthenpally basilica marks 100 years of healing and hope
content: Centenary of the Basilica of Our Lady of Dolours celebrated with messages of faith, compassion, and service

title: Amit Shah hails ethanol programme as a game changer for sugar cooperatives
content: Union Minister credits ethanol blending for strengthening cooperatives, boosting rural prosperity, and promoting indigenous production

title: ‚ÄòKalaburagi administration, public representatives have failed to provide proper flood relief‚Äô
content: There has been a persistent gap between government promises and ground reality, says Siddalinga Swami of Shiv Sena

title: Govt. to present Swachhata Awards in Andhra Pradesh on October 6
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu to give away the awards to institutions, individuals, and government departments for achieving the objectives of Swachh Andhra

title: SCR Vijayawada division creates record transporting 5.5 lakh passengers on single day
content: Record breaking figures of passengers on a single day highlighted the trust and confidence of passengers in Indian Railways, says Divisional Railway Manager

title: Ernakulam Rural police‚Äôs anti-drug film screening for migrant workers draws packed audience
content: Nearly 200 migrant workers, labour suppliers, and social workers attended the screening of the Bengali film Pao the Drugs at EVM Theatre, Perumbavoor

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. plans to develop Srisailam temple on par with Tirumala
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs Endowments officials to prepare a comprehensive master plan that balances environmental protection with temple development; govt. to request Centre to allocate 2,000 hectares of forest land for the purpose

title: Upper Bhavani project will harm wildlife and indigenous communities, says ecologist
content: The blasting will occur near the¬†Devara Betta¬†Hill, one of the most sacred hills of the¬†Todas¬†in the¬†Nilgiris, says¬†Tarun Chhabra, an ecologist and expert in¬†Toda culture

title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly Speaker Ayyanna Patrudu to participate in 68th Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference¬†
content: Ayyanna Patrudu says he is delighted to represent the A.P. Legislature at the conference being held in Barbados from October 7 to 10

title: Women's World Cup: It's 12-0 now! India thrash Pakistan by 88 runs
content: India secured a commanding 88-run victory over Pakistan in the ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup. Harleen Deol‚Äôs steady 46 and Richa Ghosh‚Äôs explosive 35* powered India to 247, while Kranti Gaud's 3/20 spearheaded a disciplined bowling effort. This win extended India's perfect ODI record against Pakistan, despite Sidra Amin's valiant 81.

title: India-US trade deal: Jaishankar draws 'red line', says efforts on to find 'landing ground'
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reiterated that US tariffs on India are "unfair," criticizing penalties for Russian oil purchases while European nations also source from Moscow. He highlighted a new level of sanctions application and the "weaponization of everything" by major powers, noting shifting global energy dynamics with the US as an exporter and China leading in renewables.

title: Hills in chaos: 20 killed as landslides hit Bengal's Mirik, Darjeeling - 10 points
content: The Darjeeling-Mirik region is grappling with one of the worst landslide incidents in recent memory, claiming at least 20 lives and stranding tourists during the festive season. With heavy rains forecast to continue, authorities are racing against time to rescue the stranded, restore connectivity, and provide relief to affected families.

title: ‚ÄòChicago is a war zone‚Äô: Trump admin declares US cities as battle field
content: The Trump administration deployed federal troops to Chicago, labeling it a "war zone," despite strong opposition from local leaders. This move, part of a broader federal intervention in Democrat-run cities, faced legal hurdles in Portland where a court blocked deployment. Public opinion is divided, yet the White House signals no retreat from its controversial strategy.

title: Pak bowler gives 'death stare'; Harmanpreet's reaction goes viral - watch
content: India secured an 88-run victory over Pakistan in the ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup, posting a competitive total of 247. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur displayed remarkable composure under pressure during a fiery exchange with Nashra Sandhu. India's disciplined bowling then ensured Pakistan was bowled out for 159, highlighting their dominance and Kaur's leadership.

title: Jeff Bezos makes a rare public appearance; says 'millions of people will live in space'
content: Jeff Bezos predicted millions will live in space within decades, choosing orbital habitats supported by robots and AI data centers. He also envisioned gigawatt-scale space data centers within 10-20 years, leveraging continuous solar power to surpass terrestrial facilities. Bezos called the current AI investment surge a "good" industrial bubble.

title: 'Don't need evidence, there's...': Ex-India cricketer's dig at Pak in Women's World Cup
content: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra and captain Suryakumar Yadav underscored India Women's commanding 11-0 ODI record against Pakistan, dismissing any rivalry. In their ICC Women's World Cup clash, India maintained control, with Pakistan struggling to chase 248. Pakistan are yet to win a game in the World Cup so far.

title: Gaza peace plan: Trump warns Hamas of 'complete obliteration'; asserts Netanyahu on board
content: US President Donald Trump has issued a stark warning to Hamas, threatening "complete obliteration" if they do not cede control of Gaza. He also pressed Israel to cease bombing for a peace deal, believing Hamas is now ready.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on why he supports Trump's $100,000 H-1B Visa fee
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang supports President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee for fresh applications, calling it a "great start" to reshape immigration policy and attract the "brightest minds." He acknowledges the high cost but believes it sets a meaningful threshold. Critics, however, warn the move could lead to brain drain and undermine America's tech leadership.

title: Fresh violence in Cuttack, 24-hour internet shutdown imposed
content: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) had organised a motorcycle rally on Sunday evening despite orders from the district administration. Officials said CCTV cameras along the route were damaged and shops in the Gourishankar Park area were set on fire after police tried to stop the procession. Due to the tense law and order situation, the state government suspended internet services from 7 pm on Sunday to 7 pm on Monday.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX wins contracts worth $714 million from Pentagon
content: The US Space Force awarded SpaceX five of seven critical military launch contracts totaling $714 million, reinforcing its dominance in Pentagon space missions. United Launch Alliance secured the remaining two missions for $428 million. Blue Origin's New Glenn rocket remains uncertified for these National Security Space Launch missions, missing out on this cycle's awards.

title: First ever! Pak batter achieves feat never done before against India in ODIs - watch
content: Sidra Amin scripted history for Pakistan in the ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup by hitting her team‚Äôs first-ever six against India in ODIs. This landmark shot, struck in the 18th over, provided a rare highlight for Pakistan‚Äôs struggling chase of India's 247. Sidra remained unbeaten on 37 in the 24th over, steadying the innings after a poor start.

title: Civil unrest in Dem cities as libs accuse Trump's 'gestapo' of running amuck
content: Urban America is gripped by civil unrest as the Trump administration escalates conflicts with Democrat-run cities. Chicago's ICE operations, dubbed "gestapo tactics," involved chemical irritants against protesters, while a federal judge blocked Trump's National Guard deployment in Portland, citing false "war-ravaged" claims. These events underscore deepening political rifts, with dissenters labeled "left-wing terrorists" and officials facing removal for defying the administration.

title: ‚ÄòMayabini‚Äô: Kaziranga welcomes baby elephant; named after Zubeen Garg's song
content: Kaziranga National Park's new elephant calf has been named Mayabini, honouring late Assamese cultural icon Zubeen Garg. Assam's Environment Minister Chandra Mohan Patowary announced the name, chosen after Garg's famous song, which held deep personal significance for him. Garg's recent death in Singapore triggered immense regional grief, making this tribute a poignant symbol of new life.

title: Hartenstein‚Äôs wife Kourtney steps back from glam life for heartfelt reason
content: Kourtney Hartenstein steps down as a ring girl after five years. She now dedicates her time to family, supporting NBA champion husband Isaiah Hartenstein and their young son. Hartenstein plans to attend Oklahoma City Thunder games this season. She also explores new work opportunities, including a family foundation. This marks a new chapter for her.

title: Jon Jones thanks Alex Pereira for dedicating UFC 320 win to late brother
content: Alex Pereira reclaimed the UFC light heavyweight title at UFC 320, defeating Magomed Ankalaev by TKO. In a poignant moment, Pereira dedicated his victory to Arthur Jones, the recently deceased brother of Jon Jones, who was a former NFL player. This heartfelt tribute resonated deeply, overshadowing the championship win itself.

title: Insider: Oilers owner Daryl Katz‚Äôs impatience clouds McDavid‚Äôs future
content: Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid's contract uncertainty is causing significant unease within the franchise as he enters his final year. Owner Daryl Katz is reportedly "antsy" over the delay, despite no animosity. NHL insider Darren Dreger suggests a 50-50 chance of an extension, possibly a short-term deal, leaving the team's future in McDavid's hands.

title: Chaos! Why was Pak batter given out vs Ind? Fatima Sana argues with official
content: Muneeba Ali was controversially run out during Pakistan's innings against India in the ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup 2025. Initially deemed "NOT OUT" after a direct hit, a rare second review revealed her bat was in the air when the stumps were hit, leading to a reversed decision. This chaotic dismissal caused significant confusion and briefly halted play.

title: Top 5 Highest-Paid NHL Players in 2025: Draisaitl, Matthews & More
content: NHL's top earners for 2025 showcase how on-ice talent translates into massive financial success. Leon Draisaitl leads the pack as the richest player, followed by Auston Matthews, Nathan MacKinnon, Connor McDavid, and Mitchell Marner. These stars leverage lucrative contracts, major endorsements, and smart investments to build their multi-million dollar empires, proving hockey is big business.

title: UP: Love story in 2023, skeletal remains in 2025 - How a wrong number ended in murder
content: A wrong number call blossomed into a secret affair, culminating in the murder of 30-year-old Sonam in Hardoi two years ago. Sonam, who pressured her married lover Maseedul to marry her, was killed by him, his brother, and father on August 8, 2023. Her skeleton was recovered from a well after two arrests, with Maseedul currently on the run.

title: Darjeeling landslides: Homes, bridge, roads, tea gardens washed out ‚Äî scary visuals emerge from Bengal
content: Torrential rains have unleashed widespread devastation in Darjeeling, triggering massive landslides that claimed at least nine lives and isolated remote villages. Homes and tea gardens were buried, and a crucial bridge collapsed, disrupting transportation. Rescue efforts face challenging terrain and continuous rainfall. Authorities are monitoring the dire situation as IMD issued a red alert, urging expedited aid for affected communities.

title: IND vs PAK: Pakistan makes comical error, drops catch - watch
content: India posted 247 all out against Pakistan in the Women's World Cup, marked by a comical dropped catch in the 50th over when fielders collided attempting to dismiss Richa Ghosh. Despite this social media talking point and subsequent quick wickets, India set a competitive total, aiming for early dominance against Fatima Sana's side.

title: Manipur ambush: Intel hints at ‚Äòcontract killing‚Äô to undermine President‚Äôs rule
content: Intelligence agencies suspect a recent Assam Rifles convoy attack in Manipur, which killed two personnel, was a politically motivated "contract killing" aimed at destabilizing the state. This unusual incident saw no claim of responsibility from the PLA, leading to arrests of 15 members. Authorities are probing potential political support amidst ongoing ethnic tensions.

title: ‚ÄòMet terrorists four times‚Äô: Aide arrested in Pahalgam attack provided logistics
content: Mohammad Yousuf Katari was arrested for his role in the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, providing logistical support like an Android phone charger and guiding the terrorists. Officials tracked the partially destroyed charger, recovered after the terrorists were killed, leading to his capture. His interrogation is expected to uncover further links in the terror support network.

title: Arbaaz Khan and wife Sshura welcome girl: Both mom and child doing well, confirms source
content: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan and wife Sshura Khan have welcomed their first child, a baby girl, on Sunday, October 5, 2025. Both mother and newborn are reportedly in good health, bringing immense joy to the entire Khan family. Salman Khan is returning to Mumbai to celebrate this happy occasion.

title: Did Pak ‚Äòunfairly‚Äô win toss against IND? Controversial call sparks debate ‚Äì Watch
content: A toss controversy erupted during the India vs Pakistan ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup match. Pakistan captain Fatima Sana seemingly called ‚Äútails,‚Äù but the official declared ‚Äúheads,‚Äù resulting in Pakistan winning the toss. This incident, which saw Pakistan opt to bowl first, sparked widespread online debate and questions about fairness, with no official clarification yet.

title: 'Went to build better future': How robbery attempt claimed Indian student's life in US
content: A 28-year-old Hyderabad student, Pole Chandrasekhar, was fatally shot in Texas, US, on October 3 during a suspected armed robbery at his part-time gas station job. Chandrasekhar, who was pursuing a master's, died on the spot. Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy expressed condolences and assured government support to repatriate his remains, with coordination underway with Indian officials.

title: India, UK kick off high-voltage 'Konkan' naval exercise in Indian Ocean
content: India and the UK commenced their major `Konkan` naval exercise in the western Indian Ocean, deploying aircraft carriers, warships, and fighters. Led by INS Vikrant and HMS Prince of Wales, the biennial drills aim to enhance interoperability and reinforce a free and open Indo-Pacific, ahead of British PM Keir Starmer‚Äôs visit. This exercise strengthens strategic ties and regional maritime stability.

title: Nepal hit by Monsoon: At least 51 dead in landslides, flood; evacuations under way
content: At least 51 people died in landslides and flooding in Ilam, Eastern Nepal, over the past 24 hours, with authorities expecting the death toll to rise. Security forces are evacuating residents in Kathmandu Valley as rivers swell. Several districts face high risk, and nearly two million people could be affected by the unexpected, renewed monsoon downpours.

title: Darjeeling landslides: Toll rises to 18; Mamata to visit affected areas tomorrow
content: Torrential rains have unleashed devastating landslides across Darjeeling and Kalimpong hills, claiming at least nine lives and leaving several missing. Vital roads are cut off, and bridges damaged, severely disrupting daily life. Rescue operations are underway amidst challenging conditions.

title: Saquon Barkley set to play vs Broncos: Eagles RB cleared after injury scare
content: The Super Bowl LIX champion Philadelphia Eagles are off to a dominant 4-0 start and are set to face the Denver Broncos today. Star running back Saquon Barkley is confirmed to play despite missing some practice, with the team's injury report not listing him.

title: Harvard trained gastroenterologist reveals 10 best foods for gas and bloating
content: Bloating occurs when excess air or gas buildup gets trapped in the digestive tract or when gut muscles fail to move food efficiently. This can be triggered by eating too fast and swallowing air, consuming gas-producing foods or food intolerances. The good news is that certain foods can actively soothe the digestive system by providing enzymes that break down food efficiently.

title: Mount Everest blizzard: Nearly 1k trapped on Tibetan side; rescue ops on
content: A severe blizzard has left nearly 1,000 stranded on Mount Everest's Tibetan side, with rescue efforts underway amid heavy snowfall. Concurrently, devastating rains in Nepal triggered landslides and flash floods, causing at least 47 deaths and leaving nine missing. Authorities in both regions are intensifying relief operations to reach affected communities and stranded visitors.

title: Bugs attack! Ind-Pak match paused for bizarre reason - watch
content: The ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup 2025 match between India and Pakistan faced an unusual challenge as a persistent swarm of flies disrupted play, visibly bothering players from both sides. Despite the insect nuisance, India reached 136 for 3 after 30 overs against Pakistan, who won the toss and chose to bowl.

title: ‚ÄòBlood will pave way to victory‚Äô: Top Hamas leader‚Äôs defiant first appearance post-Doha attack
content: Hamas negotiator Khalil al-Hayya delivered a defiant message after an Israeli strike killed his son, expressing hope for victory through sacrifice. His statement aired as indirect talks between Israel and Hamas were set to resume in Cairo, following Hamas's positive reception to a Trump-proposed peace plan for hostage exchange. Al-Hayya's focus remained on Gazan suffering.
